node.html: I built a matrix calculator in vanilla JavaScript that supports basic operations like addition, subtraction, and multiplication. It features a simple interface for entering matrices and updates the results instantly without needing a page refresh. It was a great way to sharpen my JavaScript and DOM skills while keeping the UI clean and responsive.

I built a multithreaded C program that simulates a dining hall with students and janitors, each represented by threads. Only a few student threads can enter at a time, and janitor threads wait until the hall is empty to clean. I used mutexes and condition variables to control access and prevent race conditions.

I created a lightweight cryptography tool in assembly that uses XOR-based encryption and decryption for basic file security. It gave me a chance to dive deeper into low-level programming and get more comfortable working directly with memory and registers.
